title: French Bar 2016 Gold Dust Red (California)
description: A strong aroma of cedar wood and fresh-cut oak lead to smoky cranberry, blackberry and wood-ash flavors and a flood of tannins. The wine is deep in color and aggressive in flavor.

title: Kaiken 2016 Terroir Series Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec-Petit Verdot Red (Vista Flores)
description: Forced oak projects a burning sensation and a chemical note to the nose. A clamping palate is tolerably tough, while this tastes of oak, murky berry and green notes.

title: Carramimbre 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Oaky, resiny aromas of wood grain and spice render fruit a secondary item. This is tight, raw and tough on the palate. Gamy black-fruit flavors are heavily oaked and spicy, with a strong accent of clove.

title: Bedell 2016 Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Faint aromas of citrus are covered by a bit of a soapy floral tone. Light in body and concentration, apple skin and citrus flavors are met with a mild vein of acidity.

title: Bougrier 2017 Gamay-Grolleau  (Rosé d'Anjou)
description: This medium-sweet wine is soft, fruity and clean. Red-berry flavors dominate along with a candy-shop sweetness. Drink now.

title: Bougrier 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)
description: Simple citrus fruits and a strong herbal character are the main elements of this wine that is a blend of Sauvignon Blanc from across the Loire Valley. Light and crisp, it is ready to drink.

title: Caves Velhas 2017 Cabeça de Toiro Edicão Limitada Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)
description: This soft wine is rather indistinct. Its fruit is lightly crisp but out of focus, giving a gentle wine that is ready to drink.

title: Finca la Celia 2016 Pioneer Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)
description: Gamy, foresty berry aromas lack purity but are not bad. A full, soupy mouthfeel is missing definition, while this tastes of roasted, herbal plum. Saucy, minty, green flavors control the finish.

title: Hilanda 2016 Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Top-heavy oak creates aromas of campfire, clove and maple. That same thick, oaky character is noted on a creamy palate. Flavors of clove and barrel spice dominate. In general, this oak bomb just repeats itself over and over again.

title: Las Colinas Del Ebro 2016 Red (Terra Alta)
description: Murky aromas of compost, raspberry and pineapple are less than clean. A chunky palate is more flat than lively, while this tastes largely of raisin and stewed dark-berry fruits. A flat finish with low acidity is adequate but dull.

title: Lieb 2017 Bridge Lane Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)
description: A mild nose of citrus and creamed corn carries to the medium-bodied palate. The flavors are fresher in nature, with broad citrus and melon carried by a soft vein of acidity.

title: Maryhill 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas don't seem entirely settled at present, showing some reductive notes. The palate is light, tart and tangy. It doesn't stand up on its own but might have a place at the dinner table, though the listed alcohol seems a bit high for that as well.

title: Millésimé 2012 Bleu Saphir Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 28% Cabernet Franc and 12% Merlot is very extracted on the nose with strong blackberry, pepper, roasted beef and balsamic aromas. It's tart and tangy on the palate, with a hint of black plum and mint chocolate chip.

title: Pata Negra 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: An outright woody nose smells of sawdust and mint. On the palate, this young Tempranillo shows holes in the middle. Oak-heavy flavors of clove smother what fruit this has.

title: Pedroncelli 2016 Barrel Select Classico Red (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Merlot, Zinfandel, Petite Sirah and Syrah all make it into this moderately ripe blend, which is aged under a year in American oak. Herbal with a taste of black and red currant, it finishes with a mouthful of tannin.

title: Piattelli 2016 Premium Reserve Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Wiry black fruit aromas are woody and tough. On the palate, this is chunky, plump and rubbing. Dark berry and minty green flavors are on the herbal side, while this tastes burnt and oaky on the finish.

title: A Blooming Hill Vineyard 2016 Trouble Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: You'll have to look closely to spot the Trouble designation on the front label, which differentiates this from the estate's Gemini cuvée. There are mousy scents and flavors, some blackberry fruit, and a funky finish with sour tannins.

title: Alagna 2016 Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)
description: The shy nose eventually reveals aromas that recall dark berry and baking spice. The aromas make their way over to the lean palate along with brisk acidity.
